subject: RE: [junit] JUnitDoc - University of Victoria
msgSnippet: Hi, JUnitDoc looks very cool. I have always wanted to implement it ... :-) Can someone give a pointer where it can be found and downloaded? Thanks -Vincent ...
messageBody:
Hi,

JUnitDoc looks very cool. I have always wanted to implement it ... :-)

Can someone give a pointer where it can be found and downloaded?

Thanks
-Vincent

> -----Original Message-----
> From: thong_wearin_fireman [mailto:qcircuit@...]
> Sent: 02 September 2002 19:51
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] JUnitDoc - University of Victoria
>
>
> http://www.pnsqc.org/conference/conference_home.htm
>
> 20th Annual Pacific Northwest Software Quality Conference
> Oregon Convention Center
> Portland, Oregon
> October 14 - 16, 2002
>
>
> This presentation is on the schedule:
>
> {{
>
> JUnit Extensions for Documentation and Inheritence
>
> Dan Hoffman and Sarah Wilkin, University of Victoria, BC
>
> JUnit provides support for class testing and Javadoc makes class
> documentation easier to develop. This talk describes JunitDoc, a tool
> that makes Junit and Javadoc more powerful. With JunitDoc, the
> developer:
>
> includes test cases as examples in Javadoc,
>
> extracts the cases into Junit driver, and
>
> builds test hierarchies parallel to the class hierarchies.
>
>
> }}
>
>
